page.title: 09The village of Yarley
page.content: Yarley is a small village with few amenities. It does boast one farmhouse, called Cross Farm, which provides Bed and Breakfast. Of special architectural interest is a house called Axeover, so named because it is actually built over the River Axe. Strangely enough, even when the river is high the house does not flood although the two houses opposite are often flooded by a combination of river water and water running off the hill. The house used to belong to a blacksmith and the hot metal was cooled in the stream. The present owners of the house, Mr. and Mrs. Robert Drake, have amalgamated three cottages to make the present single dwelling. Two other features of Yarley are a small ford with stepping stones and a sewage works.
